operations.notes: Find candidates by params. Returns a list of candidates

parameters.description: keyword search on all candidate fields; case insensitive; e.g. java developer
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: number of elements to return. max value is 100
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: number of elements to skip while processing result
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: job filter to display candidates who applied for a job [id]; can be used repeatedly;
parameters.name: jobId

parameters.description: location keyword search which looks up a string in a candidate’s location data; can be used repeatedly; case insensitive; e.g. Krakow
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: average rating filter to display candidates with a specific average rating (integer); can be used repeatedly; e.g. 4
parameters.name: averageRating

parameters.description: candidate’s status filter in a context of a job; can be used repeatedly; case insensitive; e.g. Hired
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: candidate’s sub-status filter in a context of a job. Works only in a correlation with a set value for the "status" field.
parameters.name: subStatus

parameters.description: tag assigned to a candidate; can be used repeatedly; case insensitive; e.g. fluent english
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: ISO8601-formatted time boundaries for the candidate update time, Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ
parameters.name: updatedAfter

operations.summary: Find candidates by params
